unnormalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai's Waste Woes Get a Makeover**
normalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai's Waste Woes Get a Makeover**

unnormalised: Hey folks, ever driven past Deonar dumping ground and held your breath? Well, there's some good news! The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is finally cracking down on waste management, implementing a new initiative starting 26/01/2024.
normalised: Hey folks, ever driven past Deonar dumping ground and held your breath? Well, there's some good news! The B M C is finally cracking down on waste management, implementing a new initiative starting twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Think community composting, folks! They're planning to roll out training programs in housing societies across Bandra and Andheri. Imagine, less garbage truck trips and more organic fertilizer for your terrace gardens!
normalised: Think community composting, folks! They're planning to roll out training programs in housing societies across Bandra and Andheri. Imagine, less garbage truck trips and more organic fertilizer for your terrace gardens!

unnormalised: Professor Sharma from IIT Bombay is even lending his expertise, helping optimize waste segregation processes. Remember those "kachra alag karo" campaigns? They're back with a vengeance!
normalised: Professor Sharma from I I T Bombay is even lending his expertise, helping optimize waste segregation processes. Remember those "kachra alag karo" campaigns? They're back with a vengeance!

unnormalised: The BMC aims to reduce landfill waste by at least 30% by 15/08/2025. A pilot project in Dadar showed promising results, with waste reduction reaching 25% within just 6 months. Also, the deadline for plastic ban implementation is extended to 01/01/2024, giving us more time to adopt eco-friendly options.
normalised: The B M C aims to reduce landfill waste by at least thirty percent by fifteenth august two thousand and twenty five. A pilot project in Dadar showed promising results, with waste reduction reaching twenty five percent within just six months. Also, the deadline for plastic ban implementation is extended to first january two thousand and twenty four, giving us more time to adopt eco-friendly options.

unnormalised: Apparently, a meeting is scheduled with residents' associations at 09:00 hrs next week. Let's hope everyone comes together for a cleaner Mumbai, shall we?
normalised: Apparently, a meeting is scheduled with residents' associations at nine zero zero hours next week. Let's hope everyone comes together for a cleaner Mumbai, shall we?
